Lucas LI is a motivated architectural engineer, freelance programmer, art lover, and lifelong learner.

Currently Lucas is working as the Competition Manager at the Organizing Committee of Solar Decathlon China, mainly responsible for ruling, compliance review, competition arrangement and implementation, and also coordinating with scoring system, site planning, team service, etc.

Lucas received his Bachelor of Building Environment & Facilities Engineering from Tongji University in 2012, and got his Master of Architectural Engineering from Purdue University in 2015, researching on building energy modeling, daylight analysis, CFD simulation, building integrated solar system, HVAC system, etc.

Architectural Engineering

Performance evaluation of building integrated solar thermal shading system
June 2014 - June 2015 ⋅ Joint work with Ming Qu and Steve Peng ⋅ West Lafayette

This research evaluated the performance of the building integrated solar thermal shading system in terms of building energy saving, daylight provision, and solar usage based on a medium office building in Los Angeles. Annual dynamic simulations were conducted to predict the year-round impacts of the BISTS system to the building... More »
